text: Honestly, the 1st Uncharted is by far the best. It has shooting portions, but it's mostly about the exploring which is what the 2nd and 3rd games lose a bit of. They're just all out shooters with tiny bits of walking in between.

text: I can only imagine how difficult it is to create an epic, iconic theme for a franchise. The composer of this masterpiece is brilliant because the music captures the essence of Drake's adventures perfectly.

text: Why does everyone say the enemies are hard? I found this game to be pretty easy. It's not a run n' gun like Gears of War. You have to use your cover and wait for the enemies to present themselves to you.

text: Really good games for the PS3. If I had to recommend any 2 PS3 exclusive series, it would be the infamous games and, of course, the uncharted games.

text: I'd have to agree with you on the annoying firefights, but I still have a soft-spot for U1. I felt that 2, and especially 3, got a little bit over-the-top in the situations Drake got thrown into, although that's just me.  Plus, those frog-people are freaky as heck.

author: alternine

text:
IMHO the 2nd one is the best one
Better graphics, better story line, better combat, better puzzles, better overall experience, I still hate the heavy armor shotgun guys.
The third made me feel like they wanted to show us too much and didn't spend enough time on what really matters.
author: Delarius

text: uncharted 2 and 3 are really amazing experiences nobody should miss, same goes for the witcher 2
author: Iwannaplayssbb

text: First game I completed on my PS3 last week. I thought it was pretty good, except for the often frustrating battle sequences. Waaaay too many of them and everytime, way too many enemies thrown at you that are all bullet sponges unless you pull headshots. The audiovisual experience was top notch though and I loved the setting. I'll be looking forward to playing Uncharted 2 seeing at it's been so well received.
author: SupraDarky
